metadata.title: CVE-2017-17498 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
WritePNMImage in coders/pnm.c in GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (bit_stream.cMagickBitStreamMSBWrite heap-based buffer overflow and application crash)or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted file.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17498` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

graphicsmagick - 1.3.27-1
graphicsmagick-imagemagick-compat - 1.3.27-1
libgraphics-magick-perl - 1.3.27-1
libgraphicsmagick++-q16-12 - 1.3.27-1
libgraphicsmagick-q16-3 - 1.3.27-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.27-1').
